question: A protocol defines the format and the order of messages exchanged between two communicating entities.
Packets are transmitted over each communication link at a rate lower than the full transmission rate of the link.

In circuit-switched networks, the resources needed along a path to provide for communication between the end systems are reserved for the duration of the communication session between the end systems.
The propagation delay has nothing to do with the distance between routers.
Store-and-forward transmission means that the switch must receive the entire packet before it can begin to transmit the first bit of the packet onto the outbound link.
At each layer, a packet has typically two components: header fields and a payload, where the payload is from the layer up.
Bit errors are more common in wireless links than in wired links.
For a given modulation scheme, the higher the SNR (signal-to-noise ratio), the lower the BER (bit error rate).
HTTP streaming is more widely used than UDP streaming by today's Internet video streaming applications.

Consider a server (S) and a client (C) connected through a router (R) by two communication links: S – R – C. Let r1 denote the rate of the link between the server and the router, and r2 the rate of the link between the router and the client. Then, the server-to-client throughput is (r1+r2).
Web caching can reduce the delay in receiving a requested object of a webpage.
There is no difference between network architecture and network application architecture.
SMTP decides how a Web page is interpreted by a Web browser.
HTTP and FTP run on top of UDP rather than TCP.
A HTTP web server uses persistent connections. The server spawns a separate process for each client that connects to the server. Each of these processes will have different server port numbers.
A company can have the same aliased name for its mail server and for its Web server.
In BitTorrent, if Alice provides chunks to Bob throughout a certain interval, Bob will necessarily return the favor and provide chunks to Alice in this same interval.
In designing a distributed hash table (DHT), there is trade-off between the number of neighbors each peer has to track and the number of messages that the DHT needs to send to resolve a single query.

File distribution using P2P architecture. Upload rate: server is 10Mbps and each client 2 Mbps. Download rate: each client is 10Mbps. There are 100 clients and the file is 12,5Mbytes. The minimum distribution time is about 50 seconds.
In a typical client-server application, the client program must be executed before the server program.
A transport-layer protocol can provide reliable data transfer only when the underlying network layer also provides reliable service.
Suppose Host A sends one TCP segment with sequence number 38 and 4 bytes of data over a TCP connection to Host B. In this same segment, the acknowledgement number is necessarily 41.
In Go-back-N, the sender is not allowed to transmit packets without waiting for an acknowledgement from the receiver.
A TCP sender window can only contain already acknowledged data.
When TCP is used, the TCP port number of the destination must be the same as the TCP port number of the source.
The size of the TCP announced receive window "rwnd" never changes throughout the duration of the connection.

Suppose Host A is sending Host B a large file over a TCP connection. If the sequence number for a segment of this connection is 100, then the sequence number for the subsequent segment will necessarily be 101.
The TCP segment has a field in its header for "rwnd". This field limits throughput performance over a high-speed network.
Suppose Host A is sending a large file to Host B over a TCP connection. The number of unacknowledged bytes that A sends cannot exceed the size of the receiver buffer.
TCP and UDP have different header size.
The IP address 192.32.216.5 in binary notation is: 11000000 00100000 11011000 00000101
A subnet, which has a CIDR address of the form a.b.c.d/26, can accommodate about 128 hosts.
Virtual circuit is connection-oriented.
Switching in a router forwards data from an input port to an output port.
HOL (head-of-the-line) blocking is a challenge more for input queued switches than for output queued switches.
Normally, routers only look at the network part and not the host part of the IP address.
With DHCP, a host may be assigned an IP address that is different each time the host is connected to the network.
ICMP (Internet control message protocol) messages are carried as IP payload.
The link-state (LS) routing algorithm is a decentralized routing algorithm.
The distance-vector (DV) routing algorithm is a global routing algorithm.
With the two-dimensional parity check scheme, the receiver can detect a double-bit error.
Because a switch isolates one link from another, the different links in the LAN can operate at different speeds.
Checksum methods provide relatively stronger protection against errors as compared to cyclic redundancy check (CRC).
FEC (forward error correction) techniques can increase the number of required sender retransmissions.
E:. Dividing the binary value 10011000 by 1001 gives a remainder of 100.
The maximum efficiency of slotted ALOHA is lower than the maximum efficiency of pure ALOHA.
In the Internet, hosts and routers not only have network-layer addresses but also have link-layer addresses.
ARP (address resolution protocol) maps between IP and MAC addresses.
An adapter's MAC address does not change no matter where the adapter is installed.
With CSMA/CD, when a collision is detected, the transmitting node stops its transmission and uses some protocol to determine when it should attempt to transmit the next time.
